properties.areaDesc: Los Angeles County Mountains excluding the Santa Monica Range
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 1 at 11:21AM PST until March 2 at 12:00PM PST by NWS Los Angeles/Oxnard CA
properties.description:
...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORIES IN EFFECT FOR THE LOS ANGELES AND
VENTURA MOUNTAINS THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH EARLY MONDAY...

.A cold storm system will affect the Los Angeles and Ventura
County Mountains through early Monday. Snow levels are expected
to drop to as low as 2500 to 3000 feet by this evening. This could
bring hazardous driving conditions to portions of the Interstate
5 Corridor and other mountain roads. Overall, snowfall totals will
average 1 to 4 inches. However, totals up to 6 inches are
possible across the eastern San Gabriel Mountains above 5000 feet.

* WHAT...Snow showers through Monday morning. Snow levels will be
around 4500 feet this afternoon, then will lower to between
2500 and 3000 feet this evening. Total snow accumulations of 2
to 4 inches are expected, except up to 6 inches across the
eastern San Gabriel Mountains above 5000 feet. Southwest winds
15 to 25 mph will shift to the north and northeast 20 to 30 mph
with local gusts to 45 mph overnight into Monday morning.

* WHERE...Los Angeles County Mountains excluding the Santa
Monica Range.

* WHEN...Until noon PST Monday.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...There will likely be light snow
accumulations across the Interstate 5 Corridor from Templin
Highway to the Grapevine and through the Tejon Pass. Be
prepared for reduced visibility at times in snow, blowing
snow, and fog.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions from CalTrans are available by calling
1 800 4 2 7 7 6 2 3.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON PST MONDAY
